Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Mabel M
Reviews.Content: We spend a week in this hostal ; the location was perfect center of the city with Metro in Puerta del Sol and with walking distances to major landsmarks. The staff very helpful in all our questions also in the restaurant, good food and very good atention. Cristina our favorite waiter. Thanks to all people.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Esivla86
Reviews.Content: This hostel is located not near, but actually in the city centre of Madrid, at no more than 20 meters from Plaza Mayor, and it takes 2 minutes to reach Puerta del Sol on foot. It's totally worth the price, given that the towels are changed every day, the rooms have a shower and the reception staff is available day and night. My room was clean, although I spotted some ash on the balcony. The shutter broke during the last day I spent there, so I didn't have any problem with it (that would definitely have been a problem if it hadn't broken during my last accommodation day, given the windows are not carefully insulated and I could feel draughts with the shutter left open). All in all, I suggest this hotel to young people who just need a place where to sleep and have a shower. Uh, to come to think of it, I didn't have my breakfast brought to the room, given I was told by a friend it's not even worth the name breakfast -on top of that, there are tons of places where to have breakfast, like Chocolatería de San Ginés serving typical "chocolate con churros" (terrific) and Starbucks, which are located extremely near the hostel.

Reviews.Title: “bad hostal”
Reviews.Author: VandaPirassununga
Reviews.Content: The place, just the place is good. The staff aren`t simpatic and they don´t help you. the hotel is dirty. The waiter at the restaurant aren´t simpatic too.

Reviews.Title: “Quality/price correct”
Reviews.Author: Mumsy51
Reviews.Content: I checked Tripadvisor before booking a room in this Hostal. The first review found was very negative. Fact is the price is low and you do not expect a 5 stars hotel for it. The Hostal is very well situated in the Center of Madrid. One on vacation will not stay in the hostal the whole day. So get out and visit Madrid as it is a beautiful city. You ring the bell and the door opens. You take a lift (not an old stair) and get up to the Hostal. The person at the reception is very friendly and speaks various languages. You get a map of Madrid and good advice where to go if you do not want to spend a fortune eating. We took a small room for two persons. This was a small room but who cares when you spend your day outside. The bathroom has all what you need for two persons. The room was kept very clean every day. (The cleaning soap used was too strong though.) This is for the plus points. What I would object though is the smell coming from the sewer through the sink, the bathtube and at time even the window. The window of the room was to a tinny courtyard. Being in Spain you can expect some noise at night. But again "be in Spain" and you will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Discriminatory Treatment from Hostal Tijcal!!!”
Reviews.Author: izzi99
Reviews.Content: We had to cancel reservation 24 hours prior to arriving due to urgent sickness and on doctor's advice to cancel our trip. We also had certificate available. However, Hostal Tijcal still charged us the full amount of the whole reservation despite the several requests I made to them to reconsider revoking their policy in such an instance. Their first excuse I got was that "Juan from reservations department already charged your credit card and has no intention to issue a refund". After I replied to such a frustrating reply I got the final reply that the Hostal Tijcal was going to stick to its policy and not refund any money!! To top this all - they would not even let us postpone our reservation. So Inconsiderate, Heartless, Unprofessional and Selfish !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location - tiniest room ever”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgent43
Reviews.Content: I booked a small room- we got a very small room! It was fine though we just had to step over our suit cases to get in and out of the bathroom which was a bit of fun. This hotel is in the best location you could want in Madrid and has a safe feel at night. There is a security door to get in and a 24 hour reception so we felt safe. There are a couple of reviews saying the stairs are dark, they had sensor lights so it wasn't a problem. The room is a bit hit and miss with a pretty dodgy shower, however they are also priced accordingly. Noise was not a problem on our stay at all, although we did keep Spanish hours, I imagine anywhere in Spain would be noisy if you tried to sleep before midnight. If you normally would say we just need a bed for the night then this place is for you - no dramas and a very good coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: happygoanywhere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hostal Tijcal in Plaza Mayor and I was not happy. The rooms look into a patio that is over a restaurant where they play loud music very very early in the morning and late into the night. The stairs leading up to the hostal are uneven and extremely dangerous and old. And then there is the staff. The guy during the day is horribly horribly rude. If you ask him for any help he either has no answer, doesn't try to help or just shrugs his shoulders and says its not his job. If I had to say something nice it would be that the beds are OK and the cleaning ladies are the only people willing to help you!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: triss2
Reviews.Content: this is the second time I have stayed in the Hostal Tijcal One it is 20 metres from the Plaza Mayor, in an area with lots of lovely restaurants, and close to all the sights the standard of cleanliness is excellent, and it has very friendly and helpful staff I noted an earlier comment on this hostal that the windows overlook other bedrooms, yes they do, via an internal courtyard, but all windows either have curtains or shutters for privacy, and its nice to have a window open for fresh air some stairways in the hostal look a little "tired" but are all clean, and the rooms themselves are spotless I had a room at the back, and there was no noise at all

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: cathhughes
Reviews.Content: Hostal Tijcal I is right in the centre of the city in ‘Sol’ and so convenient for walking to all the major sights. The reception is on the 3rd floor up quite a dark staircase with a rather old and small lift. The room was tiny with the double bed filling most of the floor space, but adequate and clean. The bathroom was even smaller with very little hot water at the end of the day. Our balcony was tiny, but you could sit on the aircon box or push a chair halfway out of the French door. The aircon was slow to get cool and is 5E a day, TV free, 1.50E a day for security box. No plug in our bathroom sink; luckily we always carry a travel one. There is a little shop selling beer, wine, and other supplies 3 doors down. The best thing about this hotel is that it is just through the arch from Plaza Mayor which is like a small version of St Mark's Square, Venice. There were free concerts on when we were there. There is also a very nice square on the other side of our hotel which was great for people watching. MADRID IS AMAZINGLY BEAUTIFUL - even nicer than Rome! Open top bus 16.50E each and is valid until midnight. The royal palace is beautiful from the outside, but no time to go in unfortunately. The cathedral next door is very modern, but nice all the same. cathathowells@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “A budget citytrip opportunity”
Reviews.Author: MetropolitanBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hostal Tijcal II a few years ago and was happy with the experience. Since that seemed fully booked, hostal Tijcal was an evident option. the location of this hostel, at Plaza Mayor and near Puerto del Sol is perfect. the environment is clean and safe and not noisy. The room was basic, small, especially the bathroom, but this is not a major issue, after all, you don't stay in Madrid to live in a hotelroom. You will have to pay for any additional services/goods (airco, additional towel, etc...) and bring your own showerproducts. There are cold drinks available in a machine at the reception (the hot drinks part was broken) Everything was clean and well kept, the staff at reception were very friendly. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in a safe and budget friendly environment. Three remarks though: - the hostel website stated there was WiFi. When I got there, my laptop did receive the connection, but it was secured. When I asked the reception about the WiFi, I was told that there was no internet in the hostel, becausing they were reinstalling it (sic). I don't know why they lied, but I was not pleased, because I needed access for work - very heavy construction work started in the building at 8 am sharp. By heavy I mean, outside walls were broken apart, underneath my window! There was hence no possibility to sleep a bit longer or take a nap during the afternoon. - the pillow was dirty

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Zuzzy
Reviews.Content: The location (right behind Plaza Mayor in a pedestrian street) is hard to beat. My room was surprisingly quiet. The room itself was pleasantly furnished, comfortable and nicely sized considering that it was a single room. The shower was great! The only thing wrong was the tiny sink... All in all, definitely nicer and less anonymous than other hostals I´ve tried in Madrid. And the price is hard to beat (I paid 25 euros for the single). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: annawellgate
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends after the Benicassim festival last year and found it excellent value for money. The staff are really helpful, they recomend places to go and things to do, provide you with maps of the city and generally make life easier. The restaurant owned by the same people is also very good although not very Spanish, they gave us free cava and a discount on our food there which was definately worth it. Brilliant location near all the main attractions and the sol square. All in all a brilliant way to end our time in spain. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostal/hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: pmulliki
Reviews.Content: I would give it 5 stars if they were not fixing the place up with heavy machinery (A lot of noise @ 10 am every day, but that is what I get for being out until 6am) and the shower would not drain well so the floor usually got wet. The staff was great, the room was small but clean and refurbished recently. Nice marble floors and the reception area was nice. Great location, very central! I would stay here again as it was very nice especially for about 35 euro a night for a single with AC and breakfast deliverd to your room every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: moomingirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hostal TIJCAL I, and the stay had good and bad points.... On the good hand the location was amazing, just through one of the arches leading out of Plaza Major... you could walk to the Royal Palace in about 10 minutes, to Puerto Del Sol in 5 minutes, and to the Prado in about 30 minutes. This central historical area was much prettier than staying at one of the many budget hotels on Gran Via for example. The staff were very helpful, with good English, and with a 24 hour reception. The decor was plain and simple, and well-maintained. Bad points were I was unlucky to get a tiny room without a window, which was horribly stuffy and smelly, even with the air conditioning, but it was very quiet and let you sleep without being kept awake by the street cleaners (or daylight!)... whereas my friends had a bigger room with a lovely little balcony, but it was very noisy with the window open. To compensate, the staff offered us free use of the air conditioning, and a token for a bit of breakfast at a local cafe. There was a small lift up to the hostal reception on the 2nd floor, or you can climb the treacherous well-worn stairs if you're feeling energetic. Basically I would recommend it if you're looking a cheap room in the best area of town.. but don't expect 5* facilities.. but what do you expect for 30 Euros per person per night! And try to request a balcony...

Reviews.Title: “Pushy, rip off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at TIJCAL and I want to warn everyone not to stay here. Staff was pushy and impolite. They try to rip you off with the breakfast deal which is worthless as it is just some bread. Manipulative, clip joint. I was treated like dirt. Do not stay here whatever you bloody do.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to return to on future visits”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found a review of this hostal, just off the Plaza Mayor, in a BBC report so booked rooms there. Costing less than $75(Amer) per night, I was apprehensive about the quality: no need, it was excellent. Newly refurbished both rooms and bathrooms are fine. As important, there is an elevator! The staff are multi-lingual and among the most helpful I found in Spain. A good breakfast can be found a few doors to your left at the Cafe Corner. This was a better hotel, as well as more cost effective than others we've tried, and we will certainly return.
